WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for reporting this! The issue has been fixed and can be tried out in the upcoming 0.9.5 release. We also have a beta available (https://typescript.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=TypeScript%200.9.5%20beta) if you'd like to try it out.
WorkItem.Description: when Silverlight debugging is enabled in the project properties (web -> debuggers) a breakpoint in TypeScript is not hit. Using VS 2012, TypeScript 0.8.2, Web Essentials 2.4.5
WorkItem.Summary: TypeScript breakpoint not hit when Silverlight debugging is enabled

Comments.Message:
Hi Bert,

Can you provide more information about your project?
Why was Silverlight debugging enabled for your project?

Hi Christopher, i've got an asp.net web api project with an silverlight frontend and a html5/javascript one. The silverlight app is added to the project using project properties -> silverlight applications -> add. So thats why I needed Silverlight debugging. I'm putting both the silverlight and html5/js/TypeScript clients in one project because deployment is easier.
Thanks for the follow up Bertt, that was exactly what we needed. I see the problem you're having even without Web Essentials, marking this as active so our devs can take a look.
